title: Christmas fear for Royal Mail: Shares fall as company faces threat of staff strikes
text:
Royal Mail is facing the threat of staff strikes during its lucrative Black Friday and Christmas period.

The result from a ballot of some 100,000 members of the Communication Workers Union will be revealed tomorrow.

Royal Mail management denies accusations that they have breached ‘the spirit and intent’ of a deal signed with the union last year that promised pay rises, a reduction to working hours and new pension proposals.

The result from a ballot of some 100,000 members of the Communication Workers Union will be revealed tomorrow

The looming conflict will pile pressure on chief executive Rico Back, as he battles falling letter deliveries and tough competition in the parcels sector.

Back, 65, took over from Moya Greene last year, but the German businessman’s appointment caused controversy after it emerged he had been paid a £5.8million ‘golden hello’.

Royal Mail shares were down nearly 4 per cent at 209.60p in early trading on Monday.
